name: Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Educational Research

Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study i: Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Educational Research This Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study (CAGS) in Educational Research prepares graduate students who already hold a graduate degree but wish to obtain a credential in educational research to enhance understanding of both Quantitative and Qualitative methods, while still allowing for specialization in one of these research paradigms and a specific research design approach. With 15 credits, this CAGS candidates will receive more specialized training in a specific application of educational research, making this more appealing to potential students while also making the certificate more marketable for future career and/or creating well prepared students for a doctoral program in education. Educational research as a focus area and program is common in research focused institutions, and with the growth Rowan University is investing in towards this direction it is now appropriate to bring this program forward for our students. This CAGS aligns with the College of Education’s mission of “preparing and supporting professionals through the development of knowledge, skills, and dispositions with the ultimate goal of ensuring equitable educational opportunities for all learners”. This CAGS is an accessible pathway for students interested in research in education, whether they come from within the field of education or not, while also providing a mechanism for individuals to leverage an existing graduate degree into a doctorate degree or increase their marketability in their profession with an advanced certification. Data in education is an increasing reality, and professionals with the skills to effectively analyze and report on data to impact educational practice and policy decisions is a huge need for our field that is on the upward trend nationally. According to the US Department of Labor online O*Net resources, social science researcher jobs broadly are growing “much faster than average”, and this CAGS addresses the skills and knowledge individuals need to be competitive in this field (i.e. processing and analyzing data of multiple types, communicating results effectively, using research software and technology, advocating for policy and practice using research evidence).
